<div class="pilwrap" id="v3.0.0-2017-01-31">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v3.0.0-2017-01-31" name="v3.0.0-2017-01-31" class="pilcrow"></a>
v3.0.0 2017-01-31
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Initial version of Nodemailer 3</li>
</ul>
<p>This update brings a lot of breaking changes:</p>
<ul>
<li>License changed from MIT to <strong>EUPL-1.1</strong>. This was possible as the new version of Nodemailer is a major rewrite. The features I don't have ownership for, were removed or reimplemented. If there's still some snippets in the code that have vague ownership then notify <a href="mailto:andris@kreata.ee.html">mailto:andris@kreata.ee</a> about the conflicting code and I'll fix it.</li>
<li>Requires <strong>Node.js v6+</strong></li>
<li>All <strong>templating is gone</strong>. It was too confusing to use and to be really universal a huge list of different renderers would be required. Nodemailer is about email, not about parsing different template syntaxes</li>
<li><strong>No NTLM authentication</strong>. It was too difficult to re-implement. If you still need it then it would be possible to introduce a pluggable SASL interface where you could load the NTLM module in your own code and pass it to Nodemailer. Currently this is not possible.</li>
<li><strong>OAuth2 authentication</strong> is built in and has a different <a href="https://nodemailer.com/smtp/oauth2/">configuration</a>. You can use both user (3LO) and service (2LO) accounts to generate access tokens from Nodemailer. Additionally there's a new feature to authenticate differently for every message â€“ useful if your application sends on behalf of different users instead of a single sender.</li>
<li><strong>Improved Calendaring</strong>. Provide an ical file to Nodemailer to send out <a href="https://nodemailer.com/message/calendar-events/">calendar events</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>And also some non-breaking changes:</p>
<ul>
<li>All <strong>dependencies were dropped</strong>. There is exactly 0 dependencies needed to use Nodemailer. This brings the installation time of Nodemailer from NPM down to less than 2 seconds</li>
<li><strong>Delivery status notifications</strong> added to Nodemailer</li>
<li>Improved and built-in <strong>DKIM</strong> signing of messages. Previously you needed an external module for this and it did quite a lousy job with larger messages</li>
<li><strong>Stream transport</strong> to return a RFC822 formatted message as a stream. Useful if you want to use Nodemailer as a preprocessor and not for actual delivery.</li>
<li><strong>Sendmail</strong> transport built-in, no need for external transport plugin</li>
</ul>
<p>See <a href="https://nodemailer.com/">Nodemailer.com</a> for full documentation</p>

<div class="pilwrap" id="2.4.0-2016-05-11">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.4.0-2016-05-11" name="2.4.0-2016-05-11" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.4.0 2016-05-11
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Bumped mailcomposer module to allow using <code>false</code> as attachment filename (suppresses filename usage)</li>
<li>Added NTLM authentication support</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.3.2-2016-04-11">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.3.2-2016-04-11" name="2.3.2-2016-04-11" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.3.2 2016-04-11
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Bumped smtp transport modules to get newest smtp-connection that fixes SMTPUTF8 support for internationalized email addresses</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.3.1-2016-04-08">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.3.1-2016-04-08" name="2.3.1-2016-04-08" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.3.1 2016-04-08
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Bumped mailcomposer to have better support for message/822 attachments</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.3.0-2016-03-03">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.3.0-2016-03-03" name="2.3.0-2016-03-03" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.3.0 2016-03-03
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug with attachment filename that contains mixed unicode and dashes</li>
<li>Added built-in support for proxies by providing a new SMTP option <code>proxy</code> that takes a proxy configuration url as its value</li>
<li>Added option <code>transport</code> to dynamically load transport plugins</li>
<li>Do not require globally installed grunt-cli</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.2.1-2016-02-20">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.2.1-2016-02-20" name="2.2.1-2016-02-20" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.2.1 2016-02-20
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug in SMTP requireTLS option that was broken</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.2.0-2016-02-18">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.2.0-2016-02-18" name="2.2.0-2016-02-18" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.2.0 2016-02-18
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>Removed the need to use <code>clone</code> dependency</li>
<li>Added new method <code>verify</code> to check SMTP configuration</li>
<li>Direct transport uses STARTTLS by default, fallbacks to plaintext if STARTTLS fails</li>
<li>Added new message option <code>list</code> for setting List-* headers</li>
<li>Add simple proxy support with <code>getSocket</code> method</li>
<li>Added new message option <code>textEncoding</code>. If <code>textEncoding</code> is not set then detect best encoding automatically</li>
<li>Added new message option <code>icalEvent</code> to embed iCalendar events. Example <a href="examples/ical-event.js.html">here</a></li>
<li>Added new attachment option <code>raw</code> to use prepared MIME contents instead of generating a new one. This might be useful when you want to handcraft some parts of the message yourself, for example if you want to inject a PGP encrypted message as the contents of a MIME node</li>
<li>Added new message option <code>raw</code> to use an existing MIME message instead of generating a new one</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.1.0-2016-02-01">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.1.0-2016-02-01" name="2.1.0-2016-02-01" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.1.0 2016-02-01
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Republishing 2.1.0-rc.1 as stable. To recap, here's the notable changes between v2.0 and v2.1:</p>
<ul>
<li>Implemented templating support. You can either use a simple built-in renderer or some external advanced renderer, eg. <a href="https://github.com/niftylettuce/node-email-templates">node-email-templates</a>. Templating <a href="http://nodemailer.com/2-0-0-beta/templating/">docs</a>.</li>
<li>Updated smtp-pool to emit 'idle' events in order to handle message queue more effectively</li>
<li>Updated custom header handling, works everywhere the same now, no differences between adding custom headers to the message or to an attachment</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="2.1.0-rc.1-2016-01-25">
  <h2>
    <a href="#2.1.0-rc.1-2016-01-25" name="2.1.0-rc.1-2016-01-25" class="pilcrow"></a>
2.1.0-rc.1 2016-01-25
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Sneaked in some new features even though it is already rc</p>
<ul>
<li>If a SMTP pool is closed while there are still messages in a queue, the message callbacks are invoked with an error</li>
<li>In case of SMTP pool the transporter emits 'idle' when there is a free connection slot available</li>
<li>Added method <code>isIdle()</code> that checks if a pool has still some free connection slots available</li>
</ul>

<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.2.1-2014-08-21">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v1.2.1-2014-08-21" name="v1.2.1-2014-08-21" class="pilcrow"></a>
v1.2.1 2014-08-21
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Bumped libmime and mailbuild versions to properly handle filenames with spaces (short ascii only filenames with spaces were left unquoted).</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.2.0-2014-08-18">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v1.2.0-2014-08-18" name="v1.2.0-2014-08-18" class="pilcrow"></a>
v1.2.0 2014-08-18
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Allow using encoded strings as attachments. Added new property <code>encoding</code> which defines the encoding used for a <code>content</code> string. If encoding is set, the content value is converted to a Buffer value using the defined encoding before usage. Useful for including binary attachemnts in JSON formatted email objects.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.1.2-2014-08-18">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v1.1.2-2014-08-18" name="v1.1.2-2014-08-18" class="pilcrow"></a>
v1.1.2 2014-08-18
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Return deprecatin error for v0.x style configuration</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.1.1-2014-07-30">

v1.1.1 2014-07-30
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Bumped nodemailer-direct-transport dependency. Updated version includes a bugfix for Stream nodes handling. Important only if use direct-transport with Streams (not file paths or urls) as attachment content.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.1.0-2014-07-29">
  <h2>

v1.1.0 2014-07-29
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Added new method <code>resolveContent()</code> to get the html/text/attachment content as a String or Buffer.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.0.4-2014-07-23">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v1.0.4-2014-07-23" name="v1.0.4-2014-07-23" class="pilcrow"></a>
v1.0.4 2014-07-23
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Bugfix release. HTML node was instered twice if the message consisted of a HTML content (but no text content) + at least one attachment with CID + at least one attachment without CID. In this case the HTML node was inserted both to the root level multipart/mixed section and to the multipart/related sub section</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.0.3-2014-07-16">

v1.0.3 2014-07-16
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Fixed a bug where Nodemailer crashed if the message content type was multipart/related</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="v1.0.2-2014-07-16">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v1.0.2-2014-07-16" name="v1.0.2-2014-07-16" class="pilcrow"></a>
v1.0.2 2014-07-16
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Upgraded nodemailer-smtp-transport to 0.1.11. The docs state that for SSL you should use 'secure' option but the underlying smtp-connection module used 'secureConnection' for this purpose. Fixed smpt-connection to match the docs.</p>

<div class="pilwrap" id="v0.5.7-2013-11-18">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v0.5.7-2013-11-18" name="v0.5.7-2013-11-18" class="pilcrow"></a>
v0.5.7 2013-11-18
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>bumped version to v0.5.7</li>
<li>Replace \r\n by \n in Sendmail transport (rolftimmermans) [fed2089e..616ec90c] A lot of sendmail implementations choke on \r\n newlines and require \n This commit addresses this by transforming all \r\n sequences passed to the sendmail command with \n</li>
</ul>

<div class="pilwrap" id="v0.5.5-2013-10-30">
  <h2>
    <a href="#v0.5.5-2013-10-30" name="v0.5.5-2013-10-30" class="pilcrow"></a>
v0.5.5 2013-10-30
  </h2>
</div>
<ul>
<li>bumped version to v0.5.5</li>
<li>Updated mailcomposer dependnecy version to 0.2.3</li>
<li>Remove legacy code - node v0.4 is not supported anymore anyway</li>
<li>Use hostname (autodetected or from the options.name property) for Message-Id instead of &quot;Nodemailer&quot; (helps a bit when messages are identified as spam)</li>
<li>Added maxMessages info to README</li>
</ul>
